SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

net.sourceforge.taglets.impl
Class DriverManager

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.taglets.impl.DriverManager

public class DriverManager
extends Object

Manages different Driver drivers.

The driver manager reads a the drivers search path from the taglets configuration and tries to instantiate a suitable Driver for the executing version of JavaDoc.

The search path is evaluated as follows:

  1. Locate driver archives:
    1. The search path is split into a list of archive locations, locations are separated by comma (e.g. "drivers/j2se15.jar, drivers/j2se14.jar").
    2. Each archive location is first searched on the classpath (using the classloader of the driver manager) and if it is not found in the file system after converting all slashes (/) to the platform file separator.
  2. To determine the preferred driver to use the driver manager iterates over all path locations and executes the following steps:
    1. If the archive is included in the classpath first make a copy to a temporary file location in order to use the URLClassLoader to load the archive.
    2. Load the archive using the URLClassLoader.
    3. Find the driver configuration properties file stored as /META-INF/driver.properties in the driver archive.
    4. Read the property Taglets.driver in the driver configuration file. The value of this property points to the driver class to instantiate.
    5. Try to instantiate a Driver driver from the property read.
    6. Execute Driver.isPreferredDriver() on the driver.
    7. If any of the above steps fail or if the driver returns false in the last step, the driver manager moves on to the next driver archive on the search path.

getClassLoader

protected ClassLoader getClassLoader(URL url)
                              throws IOException
Returns a class loader for the specified URL.

This method honors the jar: protocol used to reference resources loaded from the classpath and returns a special class loader that will load the classes from a memory cache.

In effect this allows to load JARs from the classpath.

Note:

The driver manager uses the class loader of the SimpleTaglet interface as parent class loader.

Parameters:
url - the URL that consitute the classpath of the class loader to create.
Returns:
a class loader that will serve classes and resources from the specified URL.
Throws:
IOException - I/O exceptions are passed on.
Since:
1.6.0

                    throws IOException,
                           InstantiationException,
                           IllegalAccessException,
                           ClassNotFoundException

Returns:

InstantiationException - any exceptions encountered are passed on.
